author: Staff Reporter
text:
Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam women’s wing leader Premalatha cautioned that the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam should stop indulging in cheap politics of “pulling” DMDK party functionaries to its fold. It would only bring shame and disgrace to the six-decade-old party.

If the DMK did not stop such activities, it would face a similar fate after the elections as thousands of DMK cadres would come into the DMDK fold.

Addressing an election campaign meeting here on Wednesday, she expressed concern over the defection by a DMDK district secretary, Yuvaraj, for the DMK recently, she stated that Vijayakant wished to keep with him all his cadres and persons who were with him in his early days. Tamil Nadu would give a fitting lesson to betrayers. “I have seen brightness on the face of Stalin only today. It is temporary happiness. It will not last long. The DMK will also face the music for its cheap politics. People will make defectors a symbol of disgrace,” she said.

Hitting hard at Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and her government, Ms. Premalatha said that Ms. Jayalalithaa was an illusion. People would no longer believe her illusory words. She did nothing except announcing several schemes under rule 110 in the Assembly. They were of no use to people, she said.

She also announced that only Mr. Vijayakant would announce the names of Ministers after the elections.

Agriculture and handlooms would be the two eyes of the DMDK government, she said.

“Pulling” DMDK party functionaries to its fold would only bring shame and disgrace to the six-decade-old party: Premalatha
title: “DMK should stop playing cheap politics”
